content:
Posted: May 20, 2014
												I have been thinking about buying this game. But, I never really thought much out of a fighter game, even naruto-based game like this would be PC worthy. Well, I was wrong. It has sparked the Naruto fan inside me, even thought I was a big fan of it before. I loved this show then and kinda fell off after a while because they had a new artist change the entire look of naruto. But, I felt I should put it aside and play the game. The storyline is breathtaking, that might be a level of nerd that people aren't necessarily suppose to expose. But, it truly is one of the best storylines put into a game if you haven't watched the series. Please, if you want a single player game this is the way to go. ALSO, KEY INFORMATION: If you don't have a controller, then this game will be dramatically less fun if you play it. Put the time and effort into getting a controller. It's super simple and costs less than the game itself. Especially since Xbox and Playstation are moving to the new console controllers. Go to google shops and or just best buy and they can sell you one, honestly cheaper than the game. Lastly, I highly recommend this game to all my friends and gaming peers. It's well worth the time and money. However, the multiplayer I can not recommend because I don't play multiplayer on this game.

content:
Posted: October 14, 2014
												Keyboard = BS? As my Dualshock 2 wasn't compatible with this game, keyboard was the only option I had and !"#¤% me was it hard to configure. Well the configuration per say was easy enough, but to actually bind all of the buttons needed for this game through a keyboard was a challenge in and upon itself. I believe the setup took apx 90min with some trial and error to get a grasp of the game mechanics and what worked or not. That being said... It is most definetely playable through a keyboard given the correct settings! Don't get me wrong, a controller is a much better choice mind you... Still, you can enjoy the experience and get used to playing through the keyboard as well!Game itself? I honestly didn't feel much for it at firsthand, battles feels like a mixture between the Gekkitou Ninja Taisen series on GC and Ultimate Ninja on PS2. Overall it works but I don't enjoy them nearly as much! The overworld imo doesn't fill any meaning other than being an annoying slowdown between the progress of the game per say. Speaking of which - The game feels more like a movie! Now I've played the DBZ Budokai series and they too had fights followed by cutscenes along with various unlockables, however the game definetely was more challenging and fun due to customization of capsule skills, true you can customize your items for this particular game but at the same time I never found myself using them EVEN ONCE!Overall it is almost exactly like watching the anime with the exception of worse graphics and certain altered scenes, again for the worse.. I really !"#¤% hated it in the beginning, but as time went on and what it really comes down to is that it's still very much Naruto at it's core and naturally you DO have an interest in the characters and the story...As for the gameplay, it is extremely unbalanced! it goes from certain battles being a joke to some being insane, granted you can still S rank them within 5 tries or so. There are however during certain battles and these are mainly during the bosses when you have special objectives to be filled if you wanna achieve the highest rank. Some of these being purely !"#¤%&/ LUCK BASED!!! For me this game goes to shiets at when you're supossed to rely on luck rather than skill..Bottom line is that you will most likely enjoy the game if you are a fan! But truth be told, there are better installments of the franchise and it's by far not a masterpiece by itself either. I think metacritic was very generous giving this game 80 or what they did.. I wouldn't give it more than 65 at the most!My advice is to pick it up on a sale at 9,99 AND NOT HIGHER, if you are to pick it up at some point. All I can say is don't expect greatness from it other than feeling a bit of nostalgia from the series, as the manga is to end within 8 weeks from typing this, it's fun in a sense to remember the past 15 years that has been Naruto. At the same time though, I can't wait till the anime is complete in order to re-watch the series and TRUELY feel nostalgic the correct way

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 1, 2013
												It's a must-buy for the Naruto series' fans.    Even though a quite a BIG amount of characters are the exactly same intact thing as in the previous games, there are new boss battles, new free battle and, generally, in-battle features, new chararacters, nice anime graphics and visuals...etc :)    On the other hand, the online mode is full of damned noobzz who only spam so as to win and have no fun,♥♥♥♥♥♥you off and proceed to the next rank (also quit when it comes to losing). In addition, many fans (including me) have grown indignant of purchasing EVERY damn game of these damn series, but still had to pay in order to get some freaking alternative costumes...... -_- (such a let down....)    Finally, many really beloved to the fans characters (Kin, Gin, Edo Kages, 7 Ninja Swordsmen) are found in the story mode, but not in the free battle mode.... so.... that's another negative point...   Anyway, all in all, it's a truly pleasant game that anyone, fan or not, can savor. But in contrary to that, it could potentially end up being a bit monotonus and annoying (especially when playing online). So, give it a second thought before spending your precious 40 bucks carelessly ;)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 7, 2014
												As a heavy fighting gamer, I was taken aback by the one button melee attacks at first, but that simply hides the surprising depth of the system of this game.The fighting flows extremely smoothly once you have a feel for the basics, combos are basic but with the substitution system and animation cancels, it's rare you land more than a handful of hits per string, leading to kind of back and force exchange of strikes based more on evasion than blocking.There is a bit of learning curve however, I would highly recommend playing at least 3 or 4 chapters of the story mode first before trying to play online matches.As far as the netplay goes, the netcode is a little hit or miss. When the connection is clean, the game runs without a hitch, but when the connection chugs you'll feel it in both delay and the occaisional "Transmitting Data" popup for a moment. The gameplay flow makes laggy matches far from unplayable as there really isn't any urgency with your inputs or strict timing, but it's still an inconvenience when things slow down.The single player story in this game shines bright, between the gorgeous graphics and the well written story (granted, it's yoinked from the show/manga, still a solid story), it's just a good experience. Also it's long. VERY. LONG. In a good way.Overall, I'd say this game is worth a pickup for both fighting gamers and fans of the series alike. Just don't try to fight players outside of your region online.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2015
												Highly recommended for fans of good story in games or simply fans of good anime.The fights are fun and exciting enough, and not difficult to master but the real gem is the story mode.Some events of the story have been re-written or re-ordered into meaningful progression for the game's story line, but relates the story of the 4th Great Ninja War in a concise manner compared to watching the anime which makes it more exciting when coupled with the fights (no boring fillers).The game itself made me interested in watching the anime surrounding this 4th Great Ninja War arc, and actually made it easier to get into the anime by skipping parts I already know from the game to just gather more background on the events.A spoiler here would be the game's ending is designed to culmulate events and end on an epic high note whereas the actual anime's story surrounding the ending is different and in fact continues much longer in the still ongoing anime.That's a good reason to go watch the rest of the anime to continue unraveling the story. (Note the manga is ahead and has in fact already ended.)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 13, 2016
												The first Naruto game on Steam, Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 is a great addition to the saga. I've been a fan of the Ultimate Ninja games since they were on the PS2 (in fact, I have all the Ultimate Ninja games for the PS2), as they're excellent fighting games. However, this is my first game since Ultimate Ninja 5, as I could not afford the newer consoles. The combat system has changed since the old PS2 days, going from a traditional 2D fighting style to a more open 3D arena, and I'd say it's a great change (of course, I think this change occurred when the Ultimate Ninja Storm saga started).The combat system, in itself, it's quite simple at first sight, with physical attacks alongside the traditional jutsus from the anime, and ranged attacks using different ninja weapons like shurikens or kunais. The traditional Ultimate Jutsus remain here, and they're bigger and better. The animations are pretty good, and the art style closely resembles the anime itself.As for the story, it starts with a prologue set during the destruction of Konoha by the Kyuubi, and then jumps onto the Five Kage Summit, and ends during the Fourth Great Ninja War. The story mode features the already common open world featuring several landmarks of the ninja world, including some of the hidden villages. Besides the story itself, you can also take different special missions, including fighting some "historical" battles from the franchise (ie, battles that happened before the main story of the game).The game includes a large roster of characters, each with their own skills, straight from the anime. Among them are the Hokages, the Jinchuriki, and the Akatsuki. The game also allows you to select up to two extra characters to help you along during battles, which can create some very interesting and dynamic teams.If you're a Naruto fan, or fan of fighting games in general, then this will be a great addition to your library, I recommend it.

Overall this game was a 10 out of 10 for me.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2014
												**If you are a Naruto fan** who always wanted a good Naruto game on pc go for it, its totally worth it :D Story mode is really done nicely tho ending is sort of an alternative ending which is not canon, can't blame them for that since the time this was finished cannon story was still going without any sorts of ending. Some cut scenes are very long but animated and voiced superbly so its not a torture to watch 'em. Also in story mode its not just fight after a fight after the cut scene, instead you can explore,so some side missions,send letters(sms equivalent I guess lolz) to your friends & lot more. Even after finishing the main story mode there are so much to do if you are a perfectionist. Fighting mechanism is not complicated at all but its done really well considering this is an anime based game. To finish the story mode you don't need a controller, but its not easy with the keyboard until you get used to it. This edition have all the costume(apart from Goku costume for Naruto & hello kitty costume for Sakura,Goku costume is already ported by the community) & one story dlc included,complete edition.About the multiplayer mode, this is where things went to hell,at least at the release. At the release netcode was so bad that was impossible to finish a single match without game getting disconnected. But I guess CC2 patched most stuff out & it is more than playable now. But you will need a good connection with good ping to get everything working pretty well. Also beware in matches there will be guys who will spam long range technique characters like no tomorrow to increase their win rank, believe me I played this when it was first out on ps3 thanks to my cousin and it was much worst, most characters CC2 patched out to reduce the unfair advantages I guess so that's a plus.  As a pc port its not a superb port but for me its an okay port considering this was CC2 first PC release. This is more like a direct emulation on pc type of port. It don't have any advanced graphics settings(you can only set resolution,supersampling & vsync) to play with. Game will need at least a good pc to run it on 1080p I guess since game is not greatly optimized to the pc platform. Also there is a 30fps cap that is hard coded to the game engine but it is not that noticeable but might change your decision. Game keys use the xbox style X,Y,A,B method and before starting the game you can map the controls of the keyboard, inside the game it shows X,Y,A,B keys.   As final thoughts this is the best Naruto game out there right now and a year ago nobody even thought there will be a pc port and the best thing is next Naruto game will be released to ps3,xbox 360 & pc simultaneously. Its not a perfect port but its a very enjoyable game, I have 100+ hours on this & this is the only game I've ever pre-ordered. Also this title is not going on sale very much so if you want it now go for it dattebayo :DHope my two cents helped someone with their decision =)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst is the update release of Ninja Storm 3 and it's a fighting game with some RPG elements that follows closely the story of the second part of the Naruto Shippuden manga series till its most recent chapters.The main beef of the game is its story mode: you can do some free roaming in the world of Naruto while taking part in the most important battles from the series, collect items and clear some side quests too. In story mode there are either normal battles or boss battles, with unusually strong opponents who need advanced strategies and some QTEs to be defeated. The RPG elements of Ninja Storm 3 comes into play regarding some "ultimate decisions" you can make in certain battles (which can change the way some encounters are played) and the items you can equip and use in battle (some of them being able to heal you, others to boast your stats, others to depower your opponent, ...). The game follows the series' main plot very closely, sometimes even expanding upon some specific events (and always for the better). The only downside of the story mode is the enemies AI, which leaves them wide open to exploits, making several battles rather easy (with the exception of later bosses).Ninja Storm 3 is a solid fighting game with some unique and interesting features: you can use a substitution technique in battle to escape an opponent's attack and get him easily (althought the technique works only with a set of charges that aren't always ready); you can summon a maximum of two supporting characters to either protect you, attack your enemy or pull of powerful combination moves; you can use ultimate awakening modes if low on health to gain the upper hand.Ninja Storm 3 features also a multiplayer battle mode and a free battle mode, which are made very entertaining by the high number of playable characters and combinations of them you can make.The Full Burst expansion comes with updated graphics, a challenge mode that requires you to beat a series of battles with specific conditions and a short new bonus story chapter, "Brothers reunited", which pits you against a new bonus boss, Sage Kabuto.Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst is both a great game for Naruto fans (who will surely appreciate its many details coming from the series proper) and an entertaining title for who is just looking for a fun fighting game

The combat system has changed since the old PS2 days, going from a traditional 2D fighting style to a more open 3D arena, and I'd say it's a great change (of course, I think this change occurred when the Ultimate Ninja Storm saga started).The combat system, in itself, it's quite simple at first sight, with physical attacks alongside the traditional jutsus from the anime, and ranged attacks using different ninja weapons like shurikens or kunais. The traditional Ultimate Jutsus remain here, and they're bigger and better. The animations are pretty good, and the art style closely resembles the anime itself.As for the story, it starts with a prologue set during the destruction of Konoha by the Kyuubi, and then jumps onto the Five Kage Summit, and ends during the Fourth Great Ninja War. The story mode features the already common open world featuring several landmarks of the ninja world, including some of the hidden villages. Besides the story itself, you can also take different special missions, including fighting some "historical" battles from the franchise (ie, battles that happened before the main story of the game).The game includes a large roster of characters, each with their own skills, straight from the anime. content:
Posted: August 12, 2015
												Highly recommended for fans of good story in games or simply fans of good anime.The fights are fun and exciting enough, and not difficult to master but the real gem is the story mode.Some events of the story have been re-written or re-ordered into meaningful progression for the game's story line, but relates the story of the 4th Great Ninja War in a concise manner compared to watching the anime which makes it more exciting when coupled with the fights (no boring fillers).The game itself made me interested in watching the anime surrounding this 4th Great Ninja War arc, and actually made it easier to get into the anime by skipping parts I already know from the game to just gather more background on the events.A spoiler here would be the game's ending is designed to culmulate events and end on an epic high note whereas the actual anime's story surrounding the ending is different and in fact continues much longer in the still ongoing anime.That's a good reason to go watch the rest of the anime to continue unraveling the story. (Note the manga is ahead and has in fact already ended.)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst is the update release of Ninja Storm 3 and it's a fighting game with some RPG elements that follows closely the story of the second part of the Naruto Shippuden manga series till its most recent chapters.The main beef of the game is its story mode: you can do some free roaming in the world of Naruto while taking part in the most important battles from the series, collect items and clear some side quests too. In story mode there are either normal battles or boss battles, with unusually strong opponents who need advanced strategies and some QTEs to be defeated. The RPG elements of Ninja Storm 3 comes into play regarding some "ultimate decisions" you can make in certain battles (which can change the way some encounters are played) and the items you can equip and use in battle (some of them being able to heal you, others to boast your stats, others to depower your opponent, ...). The game follows the series' main plot very closely, sometimes even expanding upon some specific events (and always for the better). The only downside of the story mode is the enemies AI, which leaves them wide open to exploits, making several battles rather easy (with the exception of later bosses).Ninja Storm 3 is a solid fighting game with some unique and interesting features: you can use a substitution technique in battle to escape an opponent's attack and get him easily (althought the technique works only with a set of charges that aren't always ready); you can summon a maximum of two supporting characters to either protect you, attack your enemy or pull of powerful combination moves; you can use ultimate awakening modes if low on health to gain the upper hand.Ninja Storm 3 features also a multiplayer battle mode and a free battle mode, which are made very entertaining by the high number of playable characters and combinations of them you can make.The Full Burst expansion comes with updated graphics, a challenge mode that requires you to beat a series of battles with specific conditions and a short new bonus story chapter, "Brothers reunited", which pits you against a new bonus boss, Sage Kabuto.Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst is both a great game for Naruto fans (who will surely appreciate its many details coming from the series proper) and an entertaining title for who is just looking for a fun fighting game

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												[No Spoilers]Did you like playing of the previous Ninja Storm games or perhaps the DBZ Budokai games? If your answer is yes then I have little doubt in my mind that you will love this game as it is all that you would come to expect from the Bandai family.To keep things to the point and spoiler free I will cover some of the Pros and Cons of the game on PC:+ The game is beautiful, the cell shaded graphics and stunning animation have been put together beautifully to make all that crazy-epic anime action come to life.+ For those of us who watch the anime or read the manga you will be happy to know that the game covers most of the story line with good accuracy [Please play it in Japanese, this is just my preference but the Japanese voice actors are the best!]. For obvious reasons the game deviates from the anime slightly towards the end to create a suitable conclusion to the in game story.+The combat system is easy to master and very fluid; this makes it relatively easy to play on a keyboard [xbox gamepad is better] and still have a lot of fun.+The main story mode allows you to explore the ninja world on foot which for naruto fans is an amazing experience; you get to see parts of the villages that you don't really get to in the anime.-A large portion of the game revolves around secondary events and requests that you get from all sorts of NPCs which is not bad as it adds a lot of extra hours to the game but running back and forth through the same areas can get tiresome. One of my biggest issues is the lack of effort put into the way you move through the world; you can run, jump and break stuff. It would have been amazing if you could actually jump on/off of trees or buildings, or at least dash.- The combat system is a little limited due to the simplicity in my oppinion and I personally would have liked to see a few mor button combinations to allow for more jitsus [special moves] than just Y+B or Y+Y+B.- Multiplayer is an option for PC but in my opinion nothing beats a console at this sort of multiplayer; not having the person in the room as you smash him/her into a mountain with a giant Rasengan is just not the same as seeing that person slumping in defeat right next to you :DTo conclude I would have to recommend this game especially right now as it is on special, it is a great addition to the Bandai fighting game family.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 25, 2016
												Yet another enjoyable Naruto game.Story:The story starts with the Five Kage Summit and ends with Naruto vs. The Tailed Beasts/Sasuke and Itachi vs. Kabuto. All the events in the game have been covered in the anime already, so people who watch the anime will have no problem following the plot. People who are new to Naruto should probably read up on the events leading up to this game.Gameplay:I played Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 (UNS 3) after having finished Revolution and Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 (UNS 4), and if you want the best gameplay then going for the newer games (especially UNS 4) might be better. UNS 3 isn't a bad fighting game by any means, but if you don't really care about the story mode there isn't really any reason why you should get this game over the other ones.Another minor complaint I have about this game is that it did feel like there was a lot more running around in between missions in this game compared to the other ones. And running around wasting time is not fun.Graphics:The graphics are good. Very anime-ish, just like a Naruto game should be. Yes, the game is locked at 30 fps, so if that is a deal breaker for you then you should pass on this game.Music:Music taken straight out of the anime. Characters sounding just like they do in the anime. What more could you want?Overall:A good fighting game that any Naruto-fan will get a lot of enjoyment out of. However, if you want to play the (in my opinion) currently best Naruto game on Steam you should probably get UNS 4 first. After finishing that game, if you still want more story then this game is a good choice, while if you want a different fighting mode (orb collection) then you might want to get Ultimate Ninja Storm Revolution instead. Or, you can do like me, and get them all. They are all good games.NARUTO SHIPPUDEN: Ultimate Ninja STORM Revolution ReviewNARUTO SHIPPUDEN: Ultimate Ninja STORM 4 Review

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												If youre a fan of Naruto or shonen anime in general, this game couldnt be better. It has vibrant stylized graphics that jump straight out the screen, epic special attacks, fantastic gameplay that leaves you coming back for more. Oh yeah, and there are TONS of characters and stages to choose from. This is a fantastic game that im glad ended up on PC, however a few small setbacks keep it from joining the greatest hits collection. So lets go over the pros and cons real quick.Pros:> Fantastic Graphics & Presentation> Highly enjoyable story and characters> Engaging and addicting gameplay> A must if youre a fan of the showCons:> Best played on a controller, if you own one.> Frustrating connection issues during online play> Balance issuesAll in all though, i think if the game ever gets its online issues patched out, i think it has the potential to be even better with functional online play. But if online isnt a concern for you, this game is just fine on its own. 8/10

												Okay, For those who doesnt want a long and boring review i recommend u skip this 1Anyway Lets start this reviewThe Pros:Improved Graphics: They have upgraded the graphic since the last storm 3 which makes the game more "realistic" Voices And Sound: The soundtrack in this game has improved too since the storm 3 and made it much better and improved. Most of the soundtracks are from the anime but there still is some new ones which is really good. You can see that the voice actors in this game really did some work on the voices. If you played the game you know what i mean.The Story: Much like the anime it plays out in the Great Fourth Ninja War. From fighting and big demon fox too playing as konohamaru this game really have some amazing characters chooses. There are some quick time events which are real fun too. DLCs: There is no you get the full package when you buy this gameThe Cons:If you buy this game on pc your gonna have a bad time. The fights in this game can sometimes be really glitchy and overall bad, there is still really nice fights but some are just naaah. Final Score:Graphics 4/5Sound 4/5Fighting: 3/5Story 3/5Total Score: 3,5/5Play this game if you really like naruto or want to try a new game. I dont recommend this game to people who doesnt read the manga or watch the anime. Sometimes it could be really confusing and some people could have a bad time with it

content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												A fantastic fighter, especially if you are a fan of the manga or show and even if your not. ****Transmission Error's or not.**** Scroll to the comments section to for transmission error fix.-- Singleplayer --If you're someone like me who can't sit through 15 seasons of filler and slow paced talking scenes the game does a great job of filling you in on most of what's happened without eating up months of your free time. Even if you have been watching or reading though it also gives you the option of picking the "Legend" route on certain fights to experience things differently; a great alternative to experiencing the same thing you've seen before but still progressing. The cut scenes are fantastically done and the option for the Japanese vocal track is always nice as I for one will punch someone if I hear Naruto say "Believe it!" one more time. Of course you are still forced to play as certain characters for certain parts that aren't always fun. Some of the boss battles can also be down right cheap, the final one for instance but hey, you only have to do it once and that's a small price to pay for how much fun is packed in there.-- General --Now for me considering I haven't played an Ultimate Ninja game before this was a welcome change from the Clash of Ninja fighting games, the cinematic, epic feel of every battle and the sheer complexity of the mechanics was something I wasn't expecting from an Anime fighter. If your looking for a little one on one kick-assery this is a fantastic place to land your feet. It is a little sad that you can't play even a tag mode or something similar, the complete lack of co-operative fighting does seem like an oversight considering how entertaining it could be and considering it's something Clash of Ninja has had since the get-go.One more key thing to point out as well is the sheer amount of content here, holy crap the content. There is the massive Story Mode, the bonus Challenge Mode with 100 battles to complete, Survival Mode, Tournament Mode, the regular VS Mode and of course Online Mode. That's a a lot of things to clear. There is also an almost obsurd amount of collectables to unlock and purchase from Titles for your online Ninja Card to Ultimate Jutsu Demonstrations. The game contains 89 (correct me if I'm wrong) playable characters with only a few available as support only, as well as several characters having different costumes. Not counting same movelist, different costumes that seven versions of Sasuke to play as, rejoice Uchiha fans. It will take a while to unlock every character mind you but that can be done by either playing and earning money or clearing the entirety of the massive story mode. So if you don't like running through the sometimes tedious boss battles and the like, just hop into VS mode and beat the crap out of your friends. Which brings us to the biggest problem - I didn't say the game was perfect.-- Multiplayer --The game does a decent job of balancing the massive roster but at the end of the day, some characters are just down right overpowered and cheap. Which can be a problem unless you happen to have mastered the game and the other person hasn't. Roughly 60% of the matches you play online will either be against the ultimate form of Naruto, Minato or Itachi and there's a reason for that. Not that the cheap characters are unbeatable but unless you're also a high tier character prepare to have an annoyingly difficult fight; oh Itachi your crows will haunt my nightmares. Of course this being said it's not the end of the world by any means. If your fighting your friends or just playing for fun it probably won't bother you and overpowered characters is something you should be expecting going into a fighter with such a massive roster that isn't aiming to be a serious competition game. Virtua Fighter this is not.****-- Multiplayer Section 2 --**** Scroll to the comments section to for transmission error fix.Another key thing I have to draw attention to is something that has been completely "broken" about this game since launch: Transmission Error's. For those of you who don't know what this is, it's a disconnection error that occurs in most matches played online, example: I have played roughly 350 matches online, completing only 120 of them. While Namco-Bandai has assured us they are working on it, it has been present since launch and still isn't fixed. They have released a NA only patch for the game that, to it's credit did work somewhat, but instead of getting disconnected in some games we are presented with a slow down kind of lag and even then, sometimes are disconnected anyways. Assuming they do, at some point fix the issue the game will be downright fantastic but until then, the loyal fan base is left raging every match until you fight someone 30 times because it doesn't disconnect you for once.-- Final Thoughts --All in all it's not a perfect game and until they sort out the transmission errors in the online portion, it will be broken for those seeking to use it. However, it still retains a fighting experience that you simply can't get somewhere else. Trying to end an epic battle with an Ultimate Jutsu is so much fun and that terrible moment when you chakra dash right into someone elses costing you the match, leaving you yelling out curses; barely coming out of a match on top thanks to a well timed awakening and realizing you lost by 1/8th a heath bar to Rock Lee and you didn't land a hit on him. Moments like these make you forget about the shortcomings of the game.If your looking for a solid fighter pick it up and prepare to lose the next few weeks of your life, and bring some friends. If your looking for a competitive fighting experience, best to wait till the fix the online before investing. But either way, buy it at some point, it's worth the money.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2014
												When i original saw the trailer for this game, i thought it was a very action/adventure/fighting packed game type, boy i was complete wrong.You can divide this game in 2 parts, the story side and the vs side.The story side obviously let you follow trough the story of the anime/manga, starting after the nagato/pain saga, returning from time to time to the 9 tails incident in the leaf 16 years before. However, this is the cool part and the sad one at the same moment. The game (if you can call it that way) has no adventure side, you follow the story in a cinematic/dialogue type, with little to no gameplay (the gameplay limits from going from 1 screen to another, and no more than 3, and this is from time to time), then, after a while, after watching a cinematic or reading the dialiogues, a confrontation between characters will happen, mostly the same fights that happened in the anime/manga. This is your gameplay, a small fight, then you go back to the cinematics/dialogues.The sad part is that you get so little gampleay that you feel ripped off your money, however, the fighting mechanics, as basic as some button mashing can be, are quite fun, specially if you have teammates with you, which help you in battle (support characters ala mvsc), from time to time you will find some quicktime events, not actually difficult, but they might take you by surprise, since there are not that many.  Yesterday, i was "Playing" chapter 4, i watched 40 minute cinematic after a 5  minute fight.The cool part is that if you have not watched that part of the story, you will catch up, and if you have, it doesnt matter, the game looks gorgeous, the art design is beautiful, the animation is very fluid, vivid colors, it is breath taking  watching the cinematics and the quick actions, i cant say the same about the english dub, but the original languaje is great.The soundtrack is allright, while the main theme of this game is a very quiet/slow song, though beautiful, it does not reflect what we are used to hear in the anime. The soundtrack is good, dont get me wrong, but it lacks the punch of songs such as rising the fighting spirit, the jiraiya theme or even the orochimaru theme, the soundtrack here does not stand out, but it does set the mood for the scene in turn. (<--- Scene, geez, im reviewing a game, never expected to say that)The controls are basic. hit, kunai, cover, kawamiri no jutsu, chakra charge, jump/dash and support buttons, not much to do there in matter of combos, just mash the b button several times and you will do a 10-12 hit combo, the cancel mechanic allows you to hit more times, but again, mashing the b button. The controller works, but its very simple.Graphics. As i mentioned before, i cannot complain about the graphics, since the game looks awesome, however, the native resolution (1280 x 720) did not managed to stress my old radeon 3870, when i tried to get more juice from the graphics, i increased them to 1440 x 900 (MAX). My card couldnt handle tomb raider at that resolution, in this game nothing changed, nothing at all, is as if i never changed the resolution in the first place.The controller. Although the controls work as intended, the problem is the support, i dont own a console nor a 360 controller, the game did not accepted my generic usb controller (first game that does that, never had an issue). So i had to play with my keyboard, which was very annoying to set up, allow me to explain.When you open the game, a menu appears, you can launch the game, customize your controls, change graphics/audio. The keyboard binding is blank by default, the first time i logged in, i couldnt do anything at all, no up/down, no back, no exit, no controller detected, i had to alt+f4.Then, i rebinded some keys (coudlnt tell what they do) and launch the game, after the first fight, i figured out some actions, i wanted to rebind to my liking now that i knew what was going on, but i couldnt do it with the rebinding options ingame, since some of the keys i was planning to use were not binded first in the pre launch menu, i had to close game to rebind (again)Then, after i was playing for a while, the first sequence appeared, i binded a,s,z,x,space,ctrl,q,w,e,r, the 4 arrows, i know what each key do, i can manage without a problem, but the quick action was requesting to press the x -yy-b-a. i do not own a 360 controller, i dont know what is the action of those buttons, why they cant add a quick action with your current binding? why does it have to be a 360 controller layout despite you are playing with a keyboard? It is not hard to change, i have seen this type of notification changes in some games for windows, why this one cant?  Seriously, the controller issue is so annoying and extremely confusing if you are not used to an xboc controller. But to be fair, once you are able to set up the thing, the controller works as intended, nothing extraordinary, it just works fine, very responsive.the versus side is self explanatory, 1v1, either pvp, pvc, or any combination, single match or team match (team match is a single match, but you have some support ala mvsc after a timer fills up). It has a ton of characters, and i mean A LOT, you cant complain about diversity, however, the gameplay for each character is very similar (at least the ones i have tried), but again, there isnt much to do when the controllers are so simplistic, the gameplay is fun though, and i believe that most will get this game just for this mode, where you can actually play.so, summing all up. Campaign has little to no gameplay, its the anime with better graphics,, Visually awesome, very bad controller configuration, soundtrack allright, fun vs mode.I recommend it, however, be careful, you are paying 40 bucks to watch the anime in super hd and play for some minutes (which IMO is worth it), if you are looking for a game packed with action/fighting/adventure this is not your game.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Another great continuation of storm series. This game brings some interesting additions to combat system which makes the game far more enjoyable and less frustriating while playing online against move spammers. There hardly is any noticable graphical change between this and previous part. But nevertheless its an amazing game that will keep you occupied for hours. The storyline is very touching if you are fan of the series otherwise it might seem very stretched and over dramatic at places. The Tailed beast fights are rather dull and camera angles are sometimes problematic. The boss fights are as epci as always giving you the feel like you are controlling the main character. I recommend this game to anyone who likes Naruto storm series, this game is very enjoyable and will keep you busy for hours.side notes:On weaker machines or laptops this game tends to lag when in local player vs player mode,no problem if you use anything with i3 + processor or higher(pc/laptop only related)Playing on keyboard is not the best but this is probably for any fighter game I strongly recommend a xbox360 controller for pc users.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2014
												Naruto, Magical Girl Storm 3 is Bandai's third attempt to convince people that they make games. The story follows the series' main protagonist, Ten-ten, in her quest to find the ten-thousand miscelaneous shuriken in order to defeat the great evil plaguing the land with her magical Ten-Thousand Shuriken Storm technique...and miss with every single one. Follow Ten-ten's adventure as she learns that truth, love, and friendship are completely meaningless if you can't hit the broad side of a barn. Cyber Connect once again proves that games are not about gameplay or story; they're about cutscenes. Witness beautiful, repetitive cutscenes brought to life with awkward dialogue in a trite, convoluted story occasionally interspersed with single button combat occasionally interspersed with pointless quick time events occasionally interspersed with more cutscenes. See The incredibly lengthy cutscenes that make you question, "Wasn't I in the middle of a boss fight?" Enjoy multiplayer's many beloved series characters, except the only one you care about. Experience the experience that would make Hideo Kojima cringe at the blatant attempt to make a movie. Naruto Magical Girl Storm 3, are you enka rapper enough? (No, you are not.)

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 6, 2014
												GOOD :) This is an AMAZING GAME! Even if you don't like naruto or anime isn't your thing in general then you shouldn't be disheartened because you'll still definitely enjoy the game. The fighting style is very good and unique and you can do some pretty sick moves. The story line is very detailed and not hard at all to understand (Although you should probably read or find out what's happened in the anime before the game's storyline. The game is awesome and a lot better than a lot of the other naruto games in the series, because they have improved the graphics a lot and you can do team ultimate finishers too. Compared to the normal ninja storm 3, full burst has some really amazing graphics in comparison and they have done a very good job of improving the game. They have added new cutscenes and about 100 more missions for the player to complete after completing the main story. BAD :( The developers are still trying to bring out several different updates for the game becuase online doesn't work very well, its playable but it glitches a lot. Secondly it's highly recommended to use a gamepad, or you can still use the 'ol keyboard but a mouse isn't compatible with the game (which really fudgin sucks!)Finally, they have bought out some new characters that weren't in the other games but they should keep some of the old ones too.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Another great continuation of storm series. This game brings some interesting additions to combat system which makes the game far more enjoyable and less frustriating while playing online against move spammers. There hardly is any noticable graphical change between this and previous part. But nevertheless its an amazing game that will keep you occupied for hours. The storyline is very touching if you are fan of the series otherwise it might seem very stretched and over dramatic at places. The Tailed beast fights are rather dull and camera angles are sometimes problematic. The boss fights are as epci as always giving you the feel like you are controlling the main character. I recommend this game to anyone who likes Naruto storm series, this game is very enjoyable and will keep you busy for hours.side notes:On weaker machines or laptops this game tends to lag when in local player vs player mode,no problem if you use anything with i3 + processor or higher(pc/laptop only related)Playing on keyboard is not the best but this is probably for any fighter game I strongly recommend a xbox360 controller for pc users.

content:
Posted: March 11, 2015
												This game is one of the best fighting/ anime games so far. There are lots of characters to play with and they all have a unique style so the gamplay is endless. Campaign:It follows the actual anime and it has enough side missions to spend time on after the main story has ended. These extra stories also unluck new pictures, substitution items, etc... even a survival mode where you can train your skills with your favourite characters. Online:Though there are a lot of idiotic persons out there, who find it funny to just camp and counter/ spam and be irritating, there are also players who want to have a great battle with you. These guys will maybe give you a hard time but with them you will be able to really learn the basics. Also the internet connection/ lag can occur quit often, though you will quickly find someone that doesnt lag and hey just add them to your friends list. I have got quite a couple active non-lagging players who I can play regularly with. Overall an amazing game, just find the right good-minded jplayers who are willing to help you and play fair and this game will keep you buzy for a long time.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2014
												The truth? I was super hyped for this game. FINALLY, a Naruto game came to PC! And since i don't owe any consoles (except for a PS2), i was over-excited to finally skip the Dolphin's Wii emulatons; the PSP imitations, and play it for real. At first, i thought it would be great, since i didn't expect to play online. And boy, was i right about that.I do'nt have any console controllers, but i managed to make my way through with the keyboard (i literally imitated Mister Sheen: WINNING!), and i felt great until i had pretty much unlocked everything. It soonly started to get boring on SP, so i tried MP. A sad thought crossed my mind after seeing the game have a bad transmission. But still, i could just keep playing with bots, so it was a very small setback.What keeps my addicted until this day, is a very simple, and perhaps unexpected thing: The Community.But not the raging quitters, the trolls, the spammers, or the IA Abusers (Neji, i'm looking at you). It was the modders. Modders like "wajinshu" in youtube, doing the first few mods for the game. Mostly Texmods, but sonly started the character swaps. Typhonua, who made some of the best swaps, not leaving much to be missed about it. Ultimate OmbuStorm for his awesome moveset mods, and many others. So yes, i'm stuck in this game, FOREVER, not because of the internet. Not because of most players. Because it's my favorite anime. Because it's worth it. And although it is a bit over-priced, i can't help it but be thankful for the guys who managed to mod it so much, everything is now accessible to us. Literally, EVERYTHING. Goku costume, Hokage Costumes, new Movesets, New Rosters. There's been thousands of mods, many of which are great, and that's what has been keeping me in here all this time.If you're a big Naruto fan, i'm sure you'll like to buy this.If you can't afford it, then i think i know what you'll end up doing. Or already did ;)

												Note: I am only about 10 hours in on PC, and most of this review is based on my 360 experiences. This game is a great way to experience the second part of the Shippuden series without all of the filler, and is a great game to play if you want a single player fighting game experience. The only downside is that there are Deidara spammers online, so finding a good lobby takes a while. For thirty bucks, it is worth it and I HIGHLY recommend that you buy this game over Revolution, because that game doesn't even have a "real" campaign. 9/10, my second favorite fighting game next to Smash.

content:
Posted: September 6, 2014
												People live their lives bound by what they accept as correct and true. That's how they define "reality". But what does it mean to be "correct" or "true"? Merely vague concepts ... their "reality" may all be a mirage. Can we consider them to simply be living in their own world, shaped by their beliefs? There probably isn't any meaning in life. Perhaps you can find something interesting to do while you are alive. Like how you found that flower. Like how I found this game.The next generation of naruto games will always surpass the previous one. It's one of the never-ending cycles in life.If you want to play this game, despise it, hate it, and live in an unsightly way... Run, and cling to life, and then some day, when you have the same eyes as I do, maybe just go and hit that play button.10/10 Believe It!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2014
												I've played the others on console and was waiting for this on PC and got it for 10 bucks during a valentine's day sale and would have paid 24 bucks gladly (40% off at time of writing). It's very fun if you are into the series or the fighting mechanic, which is quite unique (I hate typical fighting-genre games, but I love this combat system.) It was great for catching up on the series without actually watching them as ain't nobody got time for dat, though I'd recommend a controller as the keyboard and mouse controls might be jarring; you also have to make your own keybinds since they have no default! The game adds a new feature for fans of the older ones where you are fighting a group of enemies instead of just one (thought I've only seen this once) and a "branching" type system which determines what happens and how difficult it is, but doesn't seem to change much.Overall, if you don't have a controller, I'd stay away; if you like Naruto or the combat, then you should buy it if you can, but you might be able to find as good a deal as I did if you wait.

content:
Posted: January 31, 2014
												Without a doubt my favorite anime fighter to date. Has a lot of content to keep replay value alive, combat is simple and intense meaning it's easy for new comers to pick up and enjoy, story while not exactly accurate to the manga and anime (Looking at you Kage vs Madara fight) still well told, absolutley beautiful visuals, an eargasmic soundtrack, incredible bosses and in the first 5 minutes completely trumping where Dragon Sword Chronicles failed miserably this is defintly a game that can satisfy a fan of Naruto or a fan of anime in general. For those of you who are fighting game fanatics I suggest looking at gameplay first before jumping in just in case the mechanics are your thing.The only thing I can say needs improvement is the lip sync for the english voices is still pretty off. I know it's synced to the original japanese audio but I feel it could have been edited to fit the english voice. Hell it's like that for multiplayer.Regarless this is still a great game. Defintly worth the wait.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												This is a great Naruto game.yes, the game is  locked at 30 FPS.It's very smooth and can sometimes loose framerate.The campain is great even though theres a lot of loading screens .The gameplay makes up for it.The Voice acting is awsome BUT the English voice acting is not great but meh.I recommend having the language in English or your language subtitles on and the audio in Japanese. The controller is alright if you either have a ps3 or Xbox controller.I don't recommend playing with a keyboard because it will make the gameplay very hard.The main problem is multiplayer, The Transmittion error. Namco Bandai and Cyber Connect 2 are aware of the ' Transmission Error ' when trying to fight other users online and the situation is currently being looked into and there was a patch but didn't fix it.Multiplayer is still fun and great but there is a likely hood that you will get a slideshow gameplay of " Transmittion error" in the middle of the screen as you try to play.Even after the issue with multiplayer. I still recommand the game to anyone who is out there wanting to play this game if your interested in a anime,action and adventure game.That has a great Story line, Single player and multiplayer that is lacking  with problems.The error ,for now, but it is very fun and great to  play with people online.if you like these stuff i put down then this game is for you.       i give Naruto Shippuden:Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst a 8.2 / 10

content:
Posted: November 1, 2013
												I would only recommend this game to fans of the Naruto manga & anime. Otherwise you be at a complete loss when it comes to the story in this game. Now the fighting mechanics are awesome, it's super easy to pull bad♥♥♥♥♥combo's off, and the animations of some moves are badass. It's not a complex system but that's just the way I like it.  There are also tons of stuff to do after you finshed the campaign like, tournaments [with special settings], challenge missions, online battles, ninja timeline [let's you play all the previous battles from the manga/anime]. The only complaint I have about this game are the cutscenes. Some cutscenes can take over ten minutes or more, that's a bit too long if you ask me, but luckily you can skip them all.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												Overall this game is extremely good from a standpoint of how fun it is, when it works. With ongoing issues coming up with the server, in put lag, the still not yet defeated transmission errors,  and in my opinion a faulty connection system. This game is one of my favorites even along side all these issues, and within the month I've had it, my play time has surpassed everything  except Dota 2. Passing Borderlands 2, Terraria, and Skyrim. This game is extremely fun, and fluid fighting game who defines itself in it's own personal touch. Regardless of having a single 'attacking' ability this game still manages to maintain a decently high skill cap whereas you won't see a player who is obviously more inexperienced than you taking games off of you for silly things, while it is usually the case that doesn't disregard the fact that it is easily possible. Along with the the fun gameplay comes obnoxious mechanics that have extremely low skill cap and can remove  a lot of the fun from the match, with awakenings like susanoo and fuu to obnoxious characters with Instant awakening resets like Asuma or Neji. In the end, i'll recieve more anguish from losing an obviously won match to a silly awakening or such than dominating a strong playe.While this game has it's issues with server and silly low skill cap easily accessible mechanics, I still recommend this game due to, while being short, maintaining an extremely fun story line and when working fun  multiplayer combat. I feel if CC2 provides proper patching this game could be more than just 'good'. ^^

content:
Posted: March 3, 2014
												I'd like to establish that I'm not a Naruto fan— I couldn't careless about the series.Now, in Naruto Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 the story is presented in a way that those who don't follow the manga or anime could still enjoy it. Action packed quick time events will keep your attention laced into the game in between fast-paced battles. Amazing sound tracks that fit right into the atmosphere will allow you to easily be absorbed into the atmosphere; the mixture of visual and auditory elements that compliment each other gives this game a great mark in the "artistically inclined" department. If you enjoy the general artistic anime style Naruto brings then this game is a must.If you enjoy the series then this game is a must.If you enjoy using spectacular over-the-top moves then this game is a must.The following are pros and cons to the game.Pros:Fantastic artic presentationOne of the few anime[ish] games on steamGreat musicOver the top movesFast pacedMany characters to chose fromMany things to unlockConsThe melee system could've been given a bit more attention.The online battles may be filled with spamming, but there is a very helpful guide on how to beat those simpletons  LINK HERE.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
												Naruto Shippuden Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst is a great fighter, once it finally clicks. When you start the story nothing is explained and you start with a pretty hectic battle, which can rather easily be won with just some button mashing. After that comes a frustratingly long battle if you have no idea what you're doing. It took me over 40 minutes to finally beat this enemy, and by that time I understood the controls slightly better. When I was halfway into the game I was still figuring things out. It would've been nice if there was some sort of tutorial; the loading screens show moves and tips but half of the time they disappear way too quickly to properly read them. As I said, it's a great fighter with amazing visuals and cinematics (although they're a bit too long) and a bit of (linear) freedom where you can accept sidequests, find 'secrets', eat food to heal your crew and buy items that you can use during your battles.Battles are usually relatively easy and if they're not the checkpoints seem rather limited. It took me several tries to finish the last battle, with is actually pretty long (10-20 minutes). All because it didn't have enough checkpoints. The easier battles had more checkpoints, but weren't usually needed. I thought that was a bit weird... Could be me, though.The camera can also get in the way at times, but thankfully you can swing it the other way with the press of a button. Simple enough, but still noteworthy.Unfortunately, I had to skip most of the cinematics (they're uncountable, there are so many). Why ? I've never seen a single episode of this show, I have only heard of it. It's not a very newbie friendly game if you're new to the show or the game. I normally watch all cinematics but I didn't understand any of it. There are so many characters and the storyline seems to be all over the place, especially at the beginning of the game. I do know that you'll be skipping at least three cinematics every 5 minutes. They just keep coming, it's unbelievable. I don't mean this in a negative way; other fighters should take note ;) I just wish I had seen some of the episodes to know what it's all about. Behind all of the cinematics there's still enough gameplay to keep you occupied for at least a good 10 hours. Don't skip any of the movies and you can add several hours to that number. Even after finishing the game you can still finish your active sidequests, or accept new ones/ones that you hadn't found yet.The visuals are amazing. I guess the game looks (and sounds) practically the same as the TV show. Most of the times I couldn't figure out if I was watching gameplay or a cinematic. It all works very fluently, and looks amazing. Some of the QTE battles are just gorgeous ! It's just a shame that all of this is capped to 30FPS, which is absolutely noticeable when you're not fighting, but running around in the environments.In the end Naruto really impressed me. A lot. It just took about one hour to figure it out. It's a fun and solid game with amazing graphics, and if you love fighters, or Naruto, this game is a must. More please.[Rating: 79/100]

content:
Posted: March 3, 2014
												Before anythingYes I like this game and yes I am still going to play it and start playing more online.But I can not say I would pay $40 for this.Yes I got this game on sale and I think it is worth the $25Graphics - Great for the style of the game, ColorfulUI - Simple, Artistic, Easy to use.Sound - Have good headset/speakers and it sounds amazingControls - Great (With controler dont know about KB havnt used)Gameplay - Easy, Fast, interactive in game cutscenesPlayable Characters - Way to many there are what 80 characters to chose from in the game not to mention almost all them have different outfits.Story - Well I havn't watched much of the TV show so I can't really say. But the story wasn't to bad explaned things as i kept playing the game. You can sometimes chose 2 different out comes in some parts of the story. World - You can Free roam but you dont really use it much until you beat the game. I feel it was just added in the game. Lots of linear areas and lots of small one to so constant load run for 5 secs then load the next area.Multiplayer - Yes, Custimizable profile (cards), Leaderboards and ranking systemBugs? - Well the game has been running perfect for me so no bugs atmFun? - Fighting yes, Story yes (sometimes for me), Me having to run to the next area no in the terrible Free roaming system no (thank god it only takes like 30 secs to run to the next area tho).

content:
Posted: February 28, 2014
												No idea why so many complain that it is a poor port to PC.....To me the 30fps is not a big issue at all....I am using an extremely high end gaming machine and have no problems with the frame rates whatsoever....It runs perfectly fine...smooth as silk...and i don't see how ramping up the frame rates would help at all....Read up that some people have problem running this game using AMD processor, you can skip this game if you are not able to run it, but if you can run this game. Not playing it would be one of your biggest regret...Playing it using a Xbox 360 controller and it is one of the best fighting games i have played for a long time considering that i have played tons of fighting games before. There are tons of characters to choose from. The main campaign is awesome and captivating. I have no problem with the online battles as well. Seem like it is so much better after their patch. All in all, this is one game i don't mind paying full price if need be.

The game might not be worth the original $40. I'd wait until it goes on sale before buying it.You should get at least 30 hours out of it. If you're really addicted to it then that number can go way higher.

I'd definately get the second controller out and play with a friend if you can. *NOTE THAT YOU NEED A WIRED XBOX CONTROLLER TO BE ABLE TO PLAY*The downside is that you can start to get bored of this game quickly depending on who you are. The game might not be worth the original $40. I'd wait until it goes on sale before buying it.You should get at least 30 hours out of it. If you're really addicted to it then that number can go way higher.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 1, 2014
												Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja STORM 3 Full Burst is, in typical fighting game tradition, an updated version of of Ninja Storm 3. I'll start by saying that that I have not played that game, my point of comparison is the 2nd game.Combat consists on either 1 on 1 or team on team (1 character and 2 assists) fighting on a 3D plane. The offensive game consists of performing simple attack combos based on a single button and tilt, a guard breaking throw move, throwing and useing various items, and activating special finishing moves by charging up. On the defensive end the options are movement, blocking, and specific to the series Substitution Jutsu which avoid an attack and place the player behind his oppenent. The Substitution has four uses that recharge over time. In low level play this perhaps dumbs down the combat to the player who attacks first on equal substitutions coming out out with a combo but I'll leave that discussion to hardcore players.Performance wise the game leaves much to be desired. While it is colorful and good-looking for the most part, the lack of graphical options is disappointing. The game is locked at 30 fps, which seems a poor descision for a 3D fighter. These point to little care being put into the PC port. Coming from Ninja Storm 2 the story mode is huge improvement. Fans of the series will welcome how long and detailed it goes, though sometimes the cutscenes are long.  Having read the series since being as young teenager I've really lost interest in the series, reading weekly as a habit rather than a desire. That being said the game was able to bring emotions to some scenes that the manga failed to do for me. To me that is something very special and a spectacular success. Some story battles have extra moments activated by performing certain actions and performing QTEs. In the context of the story mode this was actually pretty interesting.Playing a bit online did not show a comunity as active as I thought it would be. As with any fighting game, coming in a few months later left me completely out of the meta, getting my♥♥♥♥♥handed to me by everyone playing as the 4th Hokage. The lag in game is TERRIBLE. But honestly anime based games are not serious fighters, and it is a hell of a lot of fun to play with friends. If you like the series and have people to play with, get the game. Everyone else might benefit from a demo to see if its for them.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 21, 2014
												I'm going to start with what I feel would be the negative parts of the game, and then end with what I liked.It's ironic when a Naruto game has filler, but a forgiveable amount, the actual anime is so full of unneeded garbage it's ridiculous. Please show the emotional and plot bulding flash backs, and get to fighting. Them standing around talking every 2-5 minutes is too much.Not to mention the actual traveling and "find" system was completely useless. I chose Legendary(hardest difficulty) and never used a shop, or used any ryo after getting the one achievement. There was no need for it. You'd have to be a kid, or really bad at fighting games to have to use items all the time. Not to mention it isn't even a battle requirement, ever. You could get by just from spamming ninjutsu and substitute.Too many cut scenes, it felt like work to get through the cutscenes to the content. It was like 5-10 minute cutsene, 1 minute battle,  another cutscene.Sad part is I need to replay it to unlock all the achieves. Not going to. The things they want are damn near impossible. Why I say that isn't even a matter of skill, or being bad at the game. The fighting mechanics themselves and some of the battles you just can't do what they ask. ie: 6 vs 2 battle, legendary, can't block forever, you will eventually get caught by some random spam of ninjutsu that you can't block, and it's a fight for health all the way through. Unless there is an item that magically makes you have 2 more HP bars or something. If the mechanics don't get you, the camera will. Many times the camera just pans inside my character or is at an angle I can't see anything and a bunch of them with guard break/get me caught up in a bunch of crap.I did like however when they worked plot into the actual fight. I hated standing around listening about what they're going to do. Unlocking more emotional parts, etc. It was really fun to play the action sequences.They mixed free roam into it, it looked nice, almost like you were running around in a real anime, but really fell short to previous games made in terms of map size, exploration, and items.There is many hours of content here, took me quite awhile to beat it completely. I would say maybe 10-13hrs of gameplay on your first play through. At a certain point I wished the game would finally end, the bits of filler in it from the show of them talking for ridiculously long times about the same thing between different characters probably made it longer than it should be, same as the show.As far as Naruto games go, I would probably give it 5/10. -Tried something different and were very creative in terms of UI and story presentation.- Very good artwork/textures, it was very fluid and felt like I was playing the show.- Easy to understand system, becomes pretty fluid by the time you end the game.- Captured the emotions of the anime really well.- Quirky- Had a bit too much talking and I felt bored pretty quickly at certain areas of the game.- Sounds/music didn't seem all that great, some audio glitches here and there. (Most of the time I didn't even notice their was music at all. If it had some original OST theme music in there, I must of missed it.)- While the free roam was a nice thing to have, I don't feel it was necessary, and I think it was thrown in "just because."Would I recommend it? Yes. Do Ithink it's worth what I paid for it? About 80-90%, it should of been about $5-$10 less.

content:
Posted: September 3, 2015
This review will mainly focus on the campaign.tl;dr: Really fun fighting parts, boring walking parts, long cuntscenes that will give you the feels.  Capped at 30FPS, and a bad port in general.  However I still recommend this game.Naruto Ultimate Ninja STORM 3 Full Burst's "game play" consists of 4 main parts.  First off, you have the fighting.  The fighting is really quite fun, it's action packed, and requires you to quickly learn the combos and be able to pull them off quickly.  There are also quick-time events within some of these fights, but it's not that common.Secondly, we have the walking... This part is kind of boring, you just walk to where you're supposed to be going, and you can pick up small loot from some plants and stuff on the way.  You can also talk to some people and buy from the shop.  Yuu can't use your ninja dash here, and all you can really do is jump, so I don't like this bit.Thirdly, you have the cutscenes.  There are two kinds of cutscenes, you have the ones where you press "A" after each speech bubble, I don't think this part was part of the anime, it's just filler to add more to the game (don't quote me on that though).  Then you have the proper important storyline cutscenes, where you just sit back and watch.  This part is exactly like the anime, but remade with the game engine (so it's not as pretty), and it lasts a long time, longer than the other type of cutscene (so grab some popcorn!).  I really like this part, as living the through the anime so long after this part was aired is quite nice.The game is good in the story progression, because you aren't always limited to fighting with the same character all the time, so it keeps it interesting.The arena gamemode where you pick a two characters to fight is really fun, each character has multiple outfits, which come with different movesets and combos, making it really fun.  For some reason the girls all come with bikini outfits o_O *nosebleed* ...  Jiraiya will be pleased!  You unlock these characters and their respective outfits as you go along, but I believe that quite a few characters are already there as I can't remember unlocking so many!Overall, this is a really, really bad port.  It's capped at 30FPS, has loading times for EVERYTHING, due to this being on PC,  they could have loaded a bit more of the world for God sake, not just this tiny little area!  There are plenty of invisible walls, it has weird saving mechanics, and the graphics on character is shockingly bad, tbh, I would have preferred it to have similar fighting mechanics, but on a more pixel art-based 2D world, and then focused more art talent into the cutscenes.  I really do recommend this game if you like the anime, because I love it, and I love the fighting in this game (despite being 30FPS locked.  Play with a controller if you can, and prepare to not actually play much.  This game is more of an anime, where watching and playing are not quite half and half, but I don't mind, as the fighting is incredibly fun in my opinion.Buy this game (or revolution) if you miss the anime!  And feel free to ask me any questions about the game at any time, I am glad to be of assistance if you are stuck, or are unsure of what something in the game is.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2013
												UNS3 is a strong fighter in it's own right, but also a good pick for people like me who more often than not, just don't enjoy fighters. This game has a very Beat-em' up feel to it.. it's also very simple by nature, with simple controls, combos and easy to perform moves. With that said, it has enough depth in the way that you can use those simple moves and turn it into a truly exciting game, full of satisfaction and devious trickery.This game shines most in it's multiplayer. The best way to experience this game would be locally, with a mate or seven. Failing that, you can of course take to the online mode. The netcode looks like it needs work but disconnects are a thing of the past- the real beast to worry about is latency. Fighting any friend further than my own state (Western Australia) resulted in anywhere between a few milliseconds to half a second of latency, with those in my state being as responsive as a local match. Unfortunately, and this is likely due to poor Australian internet but it's still worth noting, playing any friend overseas was unplayably laggy, resulting in only frustration for both players. It kind of draws from the game, but it's more of an issue for us here. When you do get connected, it is undoubtedly the most fun part of the game.That is of course not to say the single player doesn't excel too, oh it does. One of the best stories in a fighting game in thanks to the rich and interesting world provided by the Naruto franchise. The story itself takes place in the same arc the currently-airing anime does at time of release, the Fourth Great Ninja War. The story is solid, it has many moments that will blow your mind and a lot of them are fully playable. Each fight is as memorable as the last, nothing feels too forced or unnecessary and the pace is set nicely too, with the exception of an almost hour-long scene that just sucks the life out of the middle of the game for a while. If I were to pick some nits I'd say that the characters are a bit too stiff and they don't move during dialogue unless it's a big scripted cutscene, but when things get good, they get fantastic. Even flashbacks are implemented into story fights as you play, giving you some GREAT perspective. Some of the story is very simpified, and it focuses more on the Main characters than the Anime does, leaving out some very interesting and emotionally impacful backstory.. but it does the job. It teaches you how to play, offers hours of entertainment and will make you excited for the franchise all over again. Sadly, the ending is a little different to what happens in canon Naruto, likely to avoid spoiler territory for the anime, and thus is a little unsatisfying. It'd be nice to have gotten that little surprise at the end- for that, I highly urge you to watch the anime, the person behind that mask.. ooh! Amazing.For a Console port, it has it's issues. There's a lack of tweakable options.. you're given a choice of resolution and Anti-Aliasing and that's about it. With that said.... the game runs very smoothly, even at it's locked 30 Frames Per Second, and the Anti-Aliasing does it's job well, there's a very noticable difference and the quality is greatly improved over it's console counterparts, especially in just how smooth and clear the lines are, it helps solidify the feeling this is an Anime. It doesn't really "Feel" like a port, if that makes sense- while you're playing it, it looks great, sounds great and controls great while running smoother than butter on any decent machine.With all that said, I'd definitely recommend you give it a shot. It's got plenty of hours in store for you and is certainly a blast with friends. It's the definitive version of the game and I'm very happy it came to PC.I'll give you guys a hint for when you start playing.. don't rely on your subs too much. It's easy to think spamming them will win you a fight but if you learn to play while conserving them and recharging often, you will dominate your friends. The Chakra dash is your best friend!

content:
Posted: September 11, 2015
												As a fan of Fighting games, I've reviewed the staples of the genre. From Soul Caliber, Tekken and Virtua Fighter to the more over the top Street Fighter, Guilty Gear and BlazBlue. I even tried Power Stone on the Sega Dreamcast! But these Naruto games always breath new life in a genre that too often falls into a rut of button mashing or flimsy AI, and takes the fighting genre in a new direction. With Full Burst, there is an excellent story, epic boss battles and 100% controller support. The fighting mechanics, the visual style, and the wide range of music and sounds help this game stand out from its siblings. I don't want to spoil any story related items but It's a well written and voiced story coupled with an excellent online mode and offline multiplayer. If you can get it on sale, its replayability makes it worth the money alone, not too mention that theres upwards of 100 characters in game to fight with and against. 10/10 Would chakra again.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												The last Naruto Ultimate Ninja game I played was 3 on the ps2. I have enjoyed the series quite a bit, as it is one of my favorite 3d fighting game series to date. Now, for this one in particular, the game is very good. Unfortunately the port is not. My biggest gripes are no video options beyond anti-aliasing, screen size, v-sync, or windowed mode, the game is locked at 30 fps with no option in configs to up it to 60, and the online is extremely laggy if you can even find an opponent, which you won't. Also, while you can play with the keyboard, it is not recommended as the port was designed with controllers in mind. On the upside, the story is good. Now, I haven't kept up in the series for awhile so I had no clue what was going on, I was enjoying the ride it took me on. Characters are unlocked for multiplayer as you proceed, and there are plenty to unlock along the way. The actual gameplay is solid. You have a very simple combat style, which one button for melee, a button for ranged, block, dodge (if you have the chakra), awakenings (second forms/power ups) for most of the character, and every character has a ninjutsu and ultimate jutsu to choose from. The characters play very differently. I have found my favorites already, but it's fun to go and play all of the characters as I unlock them to see what they do. Although, if you get sick of playing against bots, you will need some actual friends. Overall, the game is great but it could have been a much better port. 7/10
